msItem.author: Gennadius of Massilia
msItem.rubric: fol. 1ra Ex cathalago uirorum illustrium Gennadii.
msItem.incipit: Orosius presbiter hispanus genere⸵ uir eloquens. et historiarum cognitor⸵ scripsit aduersus querulos cristani nominis qui dicunt defectum romane rei publice
msItem.explicit: Claruit extremo temfol. 1rbpore⸵ honorio imperium tenente.

msItem.rubric: Incipit epistula pauli orosii presbiteri de ormesta mundi contra accusatores cristianorum temporum⸵ scripta ad beatum augustinum.
msItem.incipit: Preceptis tuis parui beatissime pater augustine.
msItem.explicit: fol. 1vb hoc solo cumulatius reddidi quod libens feci.

msItem.incipit: Preceperas michi ut scriberem aduersus uaniloquam prauitatem eorum qui alieni a ciuitate dei. ex locorum agrestium competis gloss: uel compitis et pagis.
msItem.explicit: fol. 135rb De qualitate autem opusculorum tu uideris⸵ qui precepisti tibi adiudicanda si edas. per te iudicata si deleas.

msItem.filiation: Alternative readings occasionally added above the line by the original scribe.

collation.signatures: Some gatherings numbered in ink at the foot of the page: fol. 31r = iiii, with individual leaves numbered in blue ink, 1–5; 70v = vii and 80v = viii, framed, with only the frame on 90v. Leaves numbered in pencil in gathering 12.

supportDesc.condition: Top of the manuscript has suffered water damage; fols. 1–4 repaired with paper at the same time as new binding.

layoutDesc.layout: Pricked on all edges of the page for frame and individual lines. Frame also aligns running heads at the top of the page identifying the book number. Written below top line. Ruled in pencil; many minor variations in the framing pattern, with some pages providing extra guides in the centre of each margin. Line spacing 6.5–7 mm.

handDesc.handNote: Gothic textualis, first half of the twelfth century. At least two scribes (one forming the top of the ascender on letters such as ‘b’ on an angle, and the other making them straight).

decoDesc.decoNote: A 5-line Arabesque initial in blue and red with penwork opens the book; thereafter new sections open with 2-line initials, alternating between blue and red, and new books open with 3- or 4-line initials. Headings rubricated.

additions.p: Some corrections (later integrated by the original scribes) and nota marks in s. xiii pencil.
On fol. vv, Orosius de Ormesta mundi (s. xvi); Orosius de Ormesta (seu miseri) mundi. Num: 2 Aspice. ibidem num: 6 (s. xviii).
Pressmarks: 25 (spine); 1 Arch. 2-1 (spine, fol. iiv); MS. Jesus Coll. Ox. D. 34 (spine, added on blue label); 2021-2, (fol. iiv); Number 2 (25) (fol. iiir).

binding.p: Gothic binding, whittawed leather over wooden boards. Chain mark at the foot of the back cover. Traces of a medieval title on the spine, with OROSIVS at the foot of back cover, upside-down.
Rebound in twentieth century, reusing original materials.

history.origin: Probably written at Cirencester Abbey around the first half of the twelfth century. On fol. iiir, Liber Ecclesie Sancte Marie de Cyrencestr’. Orosius de Viris Illustribus (s. xiii–xiv: same hand as Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS Barlow 48, fol. ir).
history.provenance: On the cover, a note of contents appears to be in John Prise’s hand. A similar note occurs in thirteen other manuscripts at Jesus College, ten of them from Cirencester, and three of unknown provenance.
history.acquisition: Appears in the list of the books of John Prise in the 1602 donation willed to Jesus College by his son Gregory Prise (1535–1600). Neil R. Ker, ‘Sir John Prise’, The Library, 5th ser., 10, no. 1 (March 1955): 1–24, doi:10.1093/library/s5-X.1.1.
